title: How to Play Star Wars Battlefront 2 Multiplayer

steps.headline: Choose a side in the fight.
Find out what unit you are good with (Republic Units, Confederacy of Independent Systems Units, Rebel Units, or Imperial Units).
steps.description: Every player is different, and most players play with the unit that they are best with. Choose the one that is right for you.

steps.headline: Befriend your teammates and help them.
steps.description: It is in your best and collaborative interest to help each other to ensure victory. They'll ask help from you, too.

steps.headline: Don't hurt your teammate.
steps.description: If the server you are in has the team damage option on, you can potentially kill a teammate, which jeopardizes your status.

steps.headline: Travel in twos or threes when possible.
Be efficient with your ammunition.
steps.description: Although this is a step for more experienced gamers, it can lead to advantages in long, drawn-out games.

steps.headline: Hold a Command Post for at least ten seconds.
steps.description: This will ten seconds after it has been captured, as this will reduce the capture rate for the enemy, giving you an edge in protecting the Command Post.

steps.headline: Regenerate health and ammunition droids for you and your team.
steps.description: You don't want your enemy to heal while you're searching for red canisters.

steps.headline: Keep moving.
steps.description: If you stay in the same place for a while, someone can snipe you. If you have to heal and stay and in the same place, try to hide behind the droid and shift back and forth to cut down the chances of getting shot.

steps.headline: Help the defense unit when they need it.
steps.description: Don't attack unless you have to delay the enemy from their spawn point.

steps.headline: Put mines on doors, narrow passages and near a Command Post or scoring area.
steps.description: Be careful, as mines can glow and attract attention.

text: Choose a side in the fight.  Find out what unit you are good with (Republic Units, Confederacy of Independent Systems Units, Rebel Units, or Imperial Units). Every player is different, and most players play with the unit that they are best with. Choose the one that is right for you. Befriend your teammates and help them. It is in your best and collaborative interest to help each other to ensure victory. They'll ask help from you, too. Don't hurt your teammate. If the server you are in has the team damage option on, you can potentially kill a teammate, which jeopardizes your status. Travel in twos or threes when possible.  Be efficient with your ammunition. Although this is a step for more experienced gamers, it can lead to advantages in long, drawn-out games. Hold a Command Post for at least ten seconds. This will ten seconds after it has been captured, as this will reduce the capture rate for the enemy, giving you an edge in protecting the Command Post. Regenerate health and ammunition droids for you and your team. You don't want your enemy to heal while you're searching for red canisters. Keep moving. If you stay in the same place for a while, someone can snipe you. If you have to heal and stay and in the same place, try to hide behind the droid and shift back and forth to cut down the chances of getting shot. Help the defense unit when they need it. Don't attack unless you have to delay the enemy from their spawn point. Put mines on doors, narrow passages and near a Command Post or scoring area. Be careful, as mines can glow and attract attention.
